question: What is the purpose of the <head> tag in HTML?
answers: To define the main content of the page
To define the footer of the page
To define the header of the page
To define the metadata of the page
correct_answer: To define the metadata of the page

question: What is the difference between a div and a span in HTML?
answers: A div is used to group block-level elements, while a span is used to group inline elements
A div is used to group inline elements, while a span is used to group block-level elements
A div is used to create a hyperlink, while a span is used to create a form element
A div is used to create a form element, while a span is used to create a hyperlink
correct_answer: A div is used to group block-level elements, while a span is used to group inline elements

question: What is the role of the alt attribute in an tag?

To define the caption for the image

question: What is the difference between the <ul> and <ol> tags in HTML?
answers: <ul> creates a numbered list, while <ol> creates an unordered list

<ul> creates a definition list, while <ol> creates a descriptive list
<ul> creates a descriptive list, while <ol> creates a definition list
correct_answer: <ul> creates an unordered list, while <ol> creates a numbered list
